{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = Bluetake |model = BW001-R |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = |wlclass = B11 |series = |if = PCMCIA (32-bit) |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = |vendor_id = 10ec |device_id = 8180 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = JCK-GN-WLMR101 |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8180L; |chip2 = Philips;SA2400A; |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Gigabyte |manuf_model = GN-WLMR101 |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = b |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 05/14/2003 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The only subsystem (besides the default 8180 PCI ID) in '''Bluetake''''s drivers is a '''Giga-Byte''' subsystem (1458:e880). :Based on this + the card's appearance, it would appear this card is a [[Gigabyte GN-WLMR101]]. The driver seems to confirm this - it is '''Gigabyte''''s driver. :The specs. and data from the GN-WLMR101 entry (aside from the PCI ID, unk. if the SS is the same..) has been added to this one. ==Links of Interest== [http://web.archive.org/web/20051210165327/http://bluetake.com/Drivers/BW001-R_Driver.zip '''Bluetake''''s drivers for the device (via archive.org)]
[http://web.archive.org/web/20030811123456/http://www.bluetake.com/Products/BW001-R.htm Product page (also via archive.org)] [[Category:English Documentation]]
